alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hale; Marengo; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 6:47PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Marengo, southeastern Greene, southwestern Hale and southeastern Sumter Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 647 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tishabee to near Kinterbish. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Demopolis, Linden, Jefferson, Forkland, Myrtlewood, Arcola, Dug Hill, Tishabee, Pin Hook, Coatopa, Kinterbish, Chickasaw State Park, Half Acre, U.S. 80 and AL 28, Old Spring Hill, Belmont, Demopolis Lock And Dam, Gallion, McDowell and Bellamy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
